intro: Lechea intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate lechea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes many cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments by storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in rocky and sandy soils in its native habitat.
